name: pagecount
description: Markdown Page Count based on Word Count Example - a status bar contribution that reports out the number of words, lines and approximated pages in the current Markdown document and the total of all.

pagecount.showCurrentStatsInStatusbar.description: Shows the stats of the current document in the statusbar.

pagecount.showTotalStatsInStatusbar.description: Shows the stats of all documents in the statusbar.

pagecount.showEstimatedReadingTime.description: Shows the estimated time needed to read the text.

pagecount.readingTime.readingSpead.description: The reading speed used to estimate the reading time.

pagecount.readingTime.wordsPerMinute.description: The reading speed used to estimate the reading time when WPM is choosen.

pagecount.pagesizeInWords.description: The assumed number of words per page.

pagecount.pagesizeInLines.description: The assumed number of lines per page. Works best with some kind of automatic linebreaking. (no softwrap)

pagecount.pagesizeInCharacters.description: The assumed number of characters per page. (no whitespaces)

markdownEnumDescriptions:
- to estimate the page count, the characters will be counted.

- This will count every non whitespace character.

- to estimate the page count, the lines will be counted.

- This will count actual linebreaks no soft wraps.

- More acurate when you enforce a realistic line length.

- to estimate the page count, the words will be counted.

- Less accurate but will work regardles of linebreaking

pagecount.include.description: A grob pattern of wich files to count words lines and pages. Used for current page and for total pages

pagecount.excludeFromTotal.description: A grob pattern of wich files to exclude files for total calculation. Opening a files will still show the stats, but they are not added to toatal
